page.title: 15Buildings (pubs)
page.content:
To some the hub of village life is the shop, to others it is the school, but to many others it is the 2 pubs. The {Swan Inn}has had the same landlady for many years, it is very popular because of its homely atmosphere. It was originally the smithy. The{Roebuck Inn}was once a coaching house between Lichfield and Ashbourne, it is one of our oldest buildings and was once in the village centre.
When the Victorians built new houses and a school, for the Gypsum mine workers, the village centre migrated to its present position. Draycott's Post Office/shop was recently awarded second place for best village shop in Staffordshire. The village also has a garage which is a landmark for many motorists as they travel along the "main" road.
